intro: Pimpinella magna var. rubra, commonly known as the red giant cowplant, is a flowering plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbrella-like clusters called umbels. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Its reddish stems and leaves give it a distinctive appearance, making it a notable species in its habitat.
